IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: FACILITATING RESEARCH AND EDUCATION ON EARTHQUAKES, EARTH STRUCTURE, AND EARTH DYNAMICS.
IRS990.MissionDesc: FACILITATING GEOPHYSICAL RESEARCH AND EDUCATION, PROMOTING FREE AND OPEN EXCHANGE OF GEOPHYSICAL DATA AND KNOWLEDGE, FOSTERING COOPERATION TO ADVANCE GEOPHYSICAL RESEARCH AND CONVEYING ITS BENEFITS TO ALL OF HUMANITY.
IRS990.Desc: INSTRUMENTATION SERVICES INCLUDE:- A GLOBAL SEISMOGRAPHIC NETWORK (GSN) OF MORE THAN 150 PERMANENT STATIONS WORLDWIDE FOR OBSERVATIONS OF GLOBAL EARTHQUAKE ACTIVITY AND OTHER NATURAL AND MANMADE SIGNALS.- A LENDING FACILITY (PASSCAL) WITH MORE THAN 3,000 PORTABLE SEISMIC AND MAGNETOTELLURIC INSTRUMENTS FOR TEMPORARY DEPLOYMENTS WORLDWIDE (INCLUDING POLAR REGIONS) FOR STUDIES OF EARTHQUAKES AND EARTH STRUCTURE.-A TRANSPORTABLE ARRAY THAT OPERATES A SEISMOGRAPHIC NETWORK ACROSS THE STATE OF ALASKA AND PARTS OF WESTERN CANADA FOR THE STUDY OF EARTHQUAKES, VOLCANOES, WEATHER, AND OTHER PHENOMENA.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: DATA SERVICES (DS) - COLLECTS, ARCHIVES, AND CURATES ALL DATA SENT TO IRIS AND DISSEMINATES DATA UPON REQUEST.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: EDUCATION AND PUBLIC OUTREACH (EPO) PROGRAM -DEVELOPS AND DISSEMINATES EARTH SCIENCE-RELATED EDUCATIONAL RESOURCES FOR A WIDE RANGE OF AUDIENCES.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: OTHER COMMUNITY ACTIVITIES - INCLUDES SAGE MANAGEMENT/GOVERNANCE, PUBLICATIONS AND WORKSHOPS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FINANCIAL FOOTNOTE IN REGARD TO FIN 48 (ASC 740) IRIS EVALUATES UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAX POSITIONS BASED ON A MORE-LIKELY-THAN-NOT RECOGNITION STANDARD. IF THAT THRESHOLD IS MET, THE TAX POSITION IS THEN MEASURED AT THE LARGEST AMOUNT THAT IS GREATER THAN 50% LIKELY OF BEING REALIZED UPON ULTIMATE SETTLEMENT. AS OF JUNE 30, 2022 AND 2021, THERE ARE NO ACCRUALS FOR UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS. IF APPLICABLE, IRIS RECORDS INTEREST AND PENALTIES AS A COMPONENT OF INCOME TAX EXPENSE. TAX YEARS FROM 2019 THROUGH THE CURRENT YEAR REMAIN OPEN FOR EXAMINATION BY TAX AUTHORITIES.

AccountActivitiesOutsideUSGrp.RegionTxt: RUSSIA AND THE NEWLY INDEPENDENT STATES
AccountActivitiesOutsideUSGrp.TypeOfActivitiesConductedTxt: GRANTS TO RECIPIENTS IN THE REGION

GrantsToOrgOutsideUSGrp.RegionTxt: RUSSIA AND THE NEWLY INDEPENDENT STATES

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PROGRAM MANAGERS AND THEIR COMMITTEES EVALUATE SUBAWARDEE PROGRESS AND ANNUAL FUNDING RECOMMENDATIONS. THE BUSINESS OFFICE REVIEWS SUBAWARD INVOICES TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH FINANCIAL AND AWARD TERMS AND CONDITIONS. PROGRAM MANAGERS MONITOR SUBAWARDEES TO ENSURE THEY ARE ACCOMPLISHING THEIR PROGRAM GOALS AND OBJECTIVES.

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrantTxt: ONLINE MODULE FOR GEOSCIENCE CAREER EDUCATION
OPERATION OF CONTINUOUS GNSS STATIONS IN RUSSIA
ONGOING OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE OF QC FEEDBACK OF IRIS ADC
OPERATIONS OF THE IRIS/PASSCAL INSTRUMENT CENTER; GLISN SUPPORT
TA RECONNAISSANCE AND STATION DEPLOYMENT SUPPORT IN ALASKA
GLOBAL SEISMOGRAPHIC NETWORK PROGRAM; USARRAY NETWORK FACILITY OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE; ARRAY NETWORK FACILITY-METADATA
PROGRAM FOR ARRAY SEISMIC STUDIES OF THE CONTINENTAL LITHOSPHERE
ENHANCEMENT AND INSTRUCTION OF PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT
GEOSPATIAL WEB-BASED SEISMIC NETWORK FUNCTIONAL PERFORMANCE

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PROGRAM MANAGERS AND THEIR COMMITTEES EVALUATE SUBAWARDEE PROGRESS AND ANNUAL FUNDING RECOMMENDATIONS. THE BUSINESS OFFICE REVIEWS SUBAWARD INVOICES TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH FINANCIAL AND AWARD TERMS AND CONDITIONS. PROGRAM MANAGERS MONITOR SUBAWARDEES TO ENSURE THEY ARE ACCOMPLISHING THEIR PROGRAM GOALS AND OBJECTIVES.
THE TRANSPORTABLE ARRAY PROJECT WAS COMPLETED AND CLOSED OUT AT THE END OF MARCH 2022.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 4
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: INCORPORATED RESEARCH INSTITUTIONS FOR SEISMOLOGY AND UNAVCO INC. MERGED TO FORM EARTHSCOPE CONSORTIUM INC., EFFECTIVE JANUARY 1, 2023.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EDUCATIONAL AND NOT-FOR-PROFIT INSTITUTIONS CHARTERED IN THE UNITED STATES, WITH A MAJOR COMMITMENT TO RESEARCH IN SEISMOLOGY AND RELATED FIELDS, MAY BECOME VOTING MEMBERS. RESEARCH INSTITUTIONS AND OTHER NOT-FOR-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS BOTH INSIDE AND OUTSIDE THE UNITED STATES ENGAGED IN SEISMOLOGICAL RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT, WHICH MAY NOT OTHERWISE QUALIFY FOR IRIS MEMBERSHIP, MAY BE ELECTED EDUCATIONAL AFFILIATES, US AFFILIATES, OR FOREIGN AFFILIATES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: REPRESENTATIVES OF THE VOTING MEMBER INSTITUTIONS ELECT THE NINE MEMBER BOARD OF DIRECTORS BY WRITTEN BALLOT. DIRECTORS ARE ELECTED FOR THREE YEAR TERMS, WHICH HAVE BEEN STAGGERED, SO THAT THREE NEW MEMBERS ARE TYPICALLY ELECTED EACH YEAR AT THE IRIS ANNUAL MEMBERS' MEETING IN DECEMBER.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ANNUALLY, IRIS RETAINS A CPA FIRM TO PREPARE THE FORM 990, WORKING WITH THE CFO. THE CFO WILL SUBMIT THE DRAFT FORM 990 TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND THE IRIS BUDGET & FINANCE SUBCOMMITTEE FOR REVIEW PRIOR TO THE FILING DEADLINE AND REQUEST APPROVAL OF THE FILING. THE SUBCOMMITTEE MAY IDENTIFY QUESTIONS, CONCERNS OR ISSUES THAT SHOULD BE BROUGHT TO THE BOARD'S ATTENTION. THE CFO AND THE PRESIDENT WILL MAKE FINAL CORRECTIONS AND APPROVE THE FORM 990.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ANNUALLY IRIS HQ WILL DISTRIBUTE THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FORM TO COMMITTEE MEMBERS AND SENIOR STAFF. THE PRESIDENT'S DESIGNEE WILL COLLECT ALL THE FORMS AND IDENTIFY DISCLOSURES TO THE PRESIDENT, FOR ANY NECESSARY ACTION, AND MISSING FORMS TO THE PRESIDENT AND/OR THE PROGRAM MANAGER, WHO IS ASSIGNED TO FOLLOW UP WITH THE NECESSARY PARTY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE PRESIDENT'S COMPENSATION IS EVALUATED ANNUALLY BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS APPROVES THE PRESIDENT'S COMPENSATION AND THE OVERALL AVERAGE SALARY INCREASE FOR OTHER STAFF, BASED ON COMPARABILITY DATA, SUCH AS THE FEDERAL GOVERNMENT PAY INCREASES AND THE SOCIAL SECURITY ADMINISTRATION'S COST OF LIVING ADJUSTMENTS. THE BOARD'S DELIBERATIONS AND DECISIONS ARE RECORDED IN THE BOARD MINUTES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GOVERNING DOCUMENTS ARE AVAILABLE ONLINE THROUGH THE ORGANIZATION'S WEBSITE. THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.
